definition: to have one's wishes come true/wish you the best!
to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: I had promised her a candle if she sent me money; and really, who could say that the prayer hadn’t come true?
sentences.chinese: 真的，誰敢說禱告了不能心想事成呢？

sentences.english: A happy holiday, your body hard everything going to win.
sentences.chinese: 節日愉快身體硬，心想事成您準贏。

sentences.english: I wish you a happy birthday, all the best, the right man.
sentences.chinese: 祝你生日快樂，事事如意，心想事成。

sentences.english: We can do anything we want to Do if we stick to it long enough.
sentences.chinese: 只要堅持得足夠長久，我們都可以心想事成。

sentences.english: Take to send greetings to and long for, fulfill a wish good luck circle.
sentences.chinese: 帶去問候和思戀，心想事成願緣圓。

sentences.english: He who seizes the right moment is the right man.
sentences.chinese: 誰把握機遇就能心想事成。

sentences.english: I pray, can you give em one today?
sentences.chinese: 我衷心祈禱今天你能讓他們心想事成嗎？

sentences.english: Honesty is a friend of you, partner of hypocrisy is counterproductive.
sentences.chinese: 誠信是心想事成的朋友，虛僞是事與願違的伴侶。

sentences.english: Happy holidays hard physically, your prospective Horse win.
sentences.chinese: 節日愉快身體硬，心想事成您準贏。

sentences.english: I wish it might, for now I am your fool.
sentences.chinese: 我真希望你心想事成，因爲我是你的弄人。

sentences.english: You will probably not succeed thefirst time you do it.
sentences.chinese: 一蹴可及應該不太可能會那麼心想事成的如願成功。

definition: to have all one's wishes (idiom)/best wishes/all the best/may all your hopes be fulfilled
profits pouring in from all sides (idiom)/raking in money/bonanza
to wish/to express good wishes/to pray/(old) wizard
to be successful in one's studies/academic success
misfortune turns to blessing (idiom); to turn an inauspicious start to good account
lit. peace when you come or go/peace wherever you go
to climb step by step/to rise steadily/on the up and up
the time comes, fortune turns (idiom); to have a lucky break/things change for the better
